001package imagingbook.common.color.colorspace;
002
003import java.awt.color.ICC_ColorSpace;
004
005import imagingbook.common.color.cie.NamedIccProfile;
006import imagingbook.common.color.cie.StandardIlluminant;
007import imagingbook.common.math.Matrix;
008
009
010/**
011 * <p>
012 * This color space class is based on the "AdobeRGB1998.icc" profile. It only
013 * serves as an example for creating color spaces from ICC profiles.
014 * See Sec. 14.5 of [1] for details.
015 * </p>
016 * <p>
017 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; 
018 * An Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
019 * </p>
020 * 
021 * @author WB
022 * @version 2022/11/13
023 */
024@SuppressWarnings("serial")
025public class AdobeRgbColorSpace extends ICC_ColorSpace implements DirectD65Conversion, RgbReferenceData {
026
027        private static AdobeRgbColorSpace instance = null;
028        
029        private AdobeRgbColorSpace() {
030                super(NamedIccProfile.AdobeRGB1998.getProfile());       // constructor of ICC_ColorSpace
031        }
032
033        /**
034         * Returns an instance of {@link AdobeRgbColorSpace}.
035         * @return an instance of {@link AdobeRgbColorSpace}
036         */
037        public static AdobeRgbColorSpace getInstance() {
038                if (instance == null) {
039                        instance = new AdobeRgbColorSpace();
040                }
041                return instance;
042        }
043        
044        // Taken from Adobe RGB (1998) Color Image Encoding (Version 2005-05)
045        private static final double[][] Mrgbi = 
046                {{0.57667, 0.18556, 0.18823},
047                 {0.29734, 0.62736, 0.07529},
048                 {0.02703, 0.07069, 0.99134}};
049        
050        @Override
051        public float[] getWhitePoint() {
052                // (0.9505, 1.0000, 1.0891) 
053                return Matrix.toFloat(StandardIlluminant.D65.getXYZ());
054        }
055        
056        @Override
057        public float[] getPrimary(int idx) {
058                return Matrix.toFloat(Matrix.getColumn(Mrgbi, idx));
059        }
060
061}
